full_text: form g_116A-Chicago 4-27-47 Un ITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Immigration and Naturalization Service Post Office Building Chicago 7, Iilinois 0900/ December 4, 1947 File No. 33210 Mao-Ling Liu P71 University Village CHANGE OF ADDRESS 27th and omo Avenues S.E. 5052 Cedar Ave Minneapo list Minnesota MINNEAPOLIS, MINN. Dear Sir: Referring to your entry into the United States as a Section 4 (e) student, will you kindly answer the questions listed below, sign your name and then request the Registrar of the school you are attending to certify that the information given by you is true and cor- rect. A franked addressed envelope is enclosed for your convenience in making reply. Very truly yours, Andrew Jordan JAN 1948 District Director / District By: Chicago C. C. District Adjudications Davis, Way Officer Chief, Entry, Departy and Expulsion Section 1. UNIVERSITY YES Are you attending the OF MINN (school) A. indicate question 2. How many semester hours of work do you carry? A. EIGHT HOURS & 3. Are all your subjects? A. you making passing grades in of YES 70. 4 of I THESISTERM work 4. Are you employed? A. YES If you are employed, please give full particulars on the reverse of this page. Date: masting Signature 07 Student Lin Note: The Registrar will please add his comments in the space below, and mail to U. S. Immigration and Naturalization Service, Room 929, Post Office Bldg., Chicago 7, Illinois. Con't 15-48 Clara H Kenny Coat to Date: 1-15-48 Registrar Dear Admission of Records
